Body: A waiter had 3 customers. After some left he still had 4 customers.
Question: How many more customers stayed behind than those that left?

Body: Julia played tag with 14 kids on tuesday. If she played tag with 8 more kids on monday than on tuesday
Question: How many kids did she play with on monday?

Body: Allan brought 5 balloons to the park. If Jake brought 6 more balloons than the number of balloons that Allan brought
Question: How many balloons did Jake bring to the park?

Body: Jackie has 10 apples. Adam has 8 apples.
Question: How many more apples does Jackie have than Adam?

Body: Baker made 19 cakes and 131 pastries. If he sold 70 cakes and 88 pastries
Question: How many more pastries than cakes did baker make?

Body: For Gwen's birthday she received 7 dollars. She spent some money and has 5 dollars left with her.
Question: How much money did she spend?

Body: 18 red peaches, 14 yellow peaches and 17 green peaches are in the basket.
Question: How many red and yellow peaches are in the basket?

Body: Matthew gave equal numbers of crackers and cakes to his 4 friends. If he had 32 crackers and 98 cakes initially
Question: How many crackers did each person eat?

Body: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvested 56 sacks of oranges.
Question: How many sacks did they harvest per day if they harvested for a total of 14 days?

Body: Adam has 4 more apples than Jackie. Together Adam and Jackie have 14 apples. Bob has 6 apples more than Adam and Jackie together do.
Question: How many apples does Bob have?
